text: hello everybody, just started with HubSpot Design Manager, and wanted to know how can we create a marketplace page within HubSpot (with filtering options), we are looking for something like this <https://asana.com/apps> i'm not sure if we have to  code each part aside and import the code as modules, or it's ok to code all the page and then import it as a template, if you guys have any resources about HS modules and templates please share it with us, thanks

I would recommend using HubDB for this. You could create a dynamic HubDB Listing so each app would have its own landing page per se. Then you could create columns in the table for Name, Category (as a multiselect), description, Featured (boolean).
For the top carousel, simply do a call to hubdb and filter by "featured" for those items, them toss into the slick slider carousel (which is what HS uses for these types of sliders)

Another little nugget I discovered today: you can toggle global modules to be non-global by editing the meta.json file via ftp. Fair warning I’d only use it when you clone a global module to take it to non-global, or vice versa.
#new-word globality
Was going to follow up with “and yes, globality is a word.” :joy:
nice.

Anyone know of a way I could add quick tags to HS rich text editor? Like what WordPress has? Reason: sometimes clients want to add code into blog posts and we don't what them to have to type `<pre>` or `<code>`
no way that I can think of. Though I know I added this into the <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> channel before for having a dropdown to add custom css classes to be added to items
yea same as AJ
whats the name of the WYSIWYG they use on HS? <@U38EZFVFE> didnt you have a link to it before?

I think it’s tinyMCE

<https://www.tiny.cloud/>
just a guess from peaking at the code.
yes that is correct.

Question on this from a HS perspective, do you think in the DM settings beta, we could add an spot where we can add additional code to the `init` function of the TinyMCE editor? This way we could add things like additional menus or additional items for the client?
essentially, looking for a way where on a per portal basis, we can make adjustments to these so we can do things like add a classes menu, or add quick shortcuts for things like <@UATE4ATHP> suggested
This has come up a few times... also asked at Dev Day at INBOUND in the AMA.
It's a pretty interesting idea... we use to do a lot of that with Joomla wysiwyg ediors
Maybe it's in <http://Ideas.HubSpot.com|Ideas.HubSpot.com> already? - if not, let's add and upvote
It is an idea that’s been brought up a lot. The design/execution of it will be interesting.
yeah, i brought it up at the AMA and quickly felt the wave of your not the first and wont be the last to ask for this

maybe call it Rich Text Extensions and use simplified version of the custom module editor,

Basically just a wysiwyg fields thing like we do with custom modules, to add an icon for a button, and whatnot and then just a javascript pane, where we use javascript to go if the user highlighted text, wrap it with this, or pop out a few fields then once popped out pop the html/css in where the cursor is.

To make it even safer in the editor - maybe have it actually pop in a hubl tag,  which just references that html output

Then have a sample basic button, which simply wraps text in a div with a class.
The javascript could get enclosed in event handlers that HS defines - like button click so even if a button had an error, it wouldn’t nuke the whole editor until you clicked it.
did HubSpot make a change in the backend with the way html is rendered, and forcing or auto indenting divs? we just had a few sites that broke. and were fine up until this week

<@U22PKFRU5> so i found it in the ideas forum: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Configurable-Appearance-of-Richt-Text-Editors/idi-p/180216> but it was "in planning" as of 4/2018, any updates on it?
my thoughts would be adding something in the DM settings like so:
maybe even include a "reset to default" link in the bottom so if anyone does screw it up, they can just revert it back to default vars
Does anyone know - if a client have not yet upgraded to SalesForce V3 integration, would their HubSpot intelligence data stop updating in SF?
<@U9F22AQH5> I’m hoping you might know the answer to this. My latest Contacts in SF are showing up as “No HubSpot Data on file.”  Would appreciate any help you can shed here!
Yes, we were trying to minimize the HTML. It is disabled now.
Let me know your portal, I can clear the CDN cache if needed.

thank you for disabling it, i noticed it after i jumped off the phone with support to try and provide screenshots. if this is something you are looking to implement, can you make it an option in the backend so older sites wont break?
Sorry to break your site. Can you share your site so that we can take a look? Thanks.
okay to DM you?
yes

<@U7TAZ6V2Q> You're correct; if you're not upgraded to V3, then new syncs won't create a HubSpot Intelligence module. That module is what populates the visualforce window. You should upgrade the integration as soon as you can; the upgrade includes a new version of that window
Ahh ok. That makes sense. Thank you so much. I can relay that to my client.

i have a “similar” problem in our portals, we built custom modules with some tags (ex. {% form “my_form” %} ) and this modules just breaked last week, now we have more than 300 pages with missing forms
is that part of that “optimization” <@U6TBZ66FN>?
i already open a ticket with a screen record to explain the problem: #2055801 please check it, PLEASE!
question I've always wondered: how long as a HubSpot 301 redirect take to come in place? Doesn't seem to be a short period of time, always like a couple hours
COS url mapping*

Has someone any issues with Page Editor ?
One of my clients have many troubles (module position change inside flex column...)
